snippet.textDisplay: Ahh, no game thoroughly kicked my ass when I was a kid like Mega Man X. And nobody was better at it than Storm Eagle. I liked this song so much that I would always rush to him first, even though I didn't have the dash upgrade required to fight him. Many deaths followed.
snippet.textOriginal: Ahh, no game thoroughly kicked my ass when I was a kid like Mega Man X. And nobody was better at it than Storm Eagle. I liked this song so much that I would always rush to him first, even though I didn't have the dash upgrade required to fight him. Many deaths followed.

snippet.textDisplay: I honestly don't see the appeal to this song. This song, Mammoth's and Chameleon's sound too alike, and uninspired. The tracks that really stand out for me in MMX are Mandrill's, Armadillo's, and Sigma's first stage.
snippet.textOriginal: I honestly don't see the appeal to this song. This song, Mammoth's and Chameleon's sound too alike, and uninspired. The tracks that really stand out for me in MMX are Mandrill's, Armadillo's, and Sigma's first stage.

snippet.textDisplay:
I saw Megaman 7 being played on a TV video game show long ago and asked my mom if she could go look for it for my birthday. She found Megaman X instead, and it was awesome.

I had so much trouble with the final boss though, but I did beat him.
